1283.question: Does DCA or GMM-based attention perform better in experiments?

4-Table3-1.png: DCA performs better in experiments as it has a higher value of 4.31 ± 0.06 for Lessac compared to GMM-based attention which has a value of 4.32 ± 0.06 for Lessac.</s>

Based on the table, DCA has a value of 4.31 ± 0.06 for Lessac and 4.33 ± 0.06 for LJ, while GMM-based attention has values of 4.32 ± 0.06 for Lessac and 4.29 ± 0.06 for LJ. Thus, DCA performs slightly better than GMM-based attention in both datasets.</s>
